channel.title: Distrelec Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6918] Ensure notification email of distFACTFinderExportCronJob is sent
item.summary: Ensure notification email of distFACTFinderExportCronJob is sent

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The composite cron job will send a notification email to the address defined by the property factfinderExportCronjob.notification.emailaddress:

  • eplatform-factfinder-d@distrelec.com OR
  • eplatform-factfinder-q@distrelec.com OR
  • eplatform-factfinder-p@distrelec.com

@Rafael: Please test whether FF export CronJob notification emails are sent correctly.
As of v3.4.2 you should receive one email after the whole composite job (export of all the channels) is performed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6875] FF - Export query update
item.description:
An url rewritting optimization have been implemented on dev/Q.
In order to display correct url inside FF export, we need to use the same data.

As explained here, please implement the functionnality inside fact finder export.

It's normally just an sql modification deployable without dependancies on P deployement (to confirm).

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: @Nabil : Please estimate time to implement on Q/P + add technical specfications in the ticket description.
Status?

Issues found during test of DistFactFinderProductExportQueryCreator3:

  • Category1, Category2, Category3, Category4, Category5, Category6, Category7 => change back from nameSeo to name
  • TypeNameNormalized => use the new database field typeNameSeo

The new version of the FF export is now ready. Please check on Q after deployment of v3.4.2.

Note: please note that it will be available as first step only for CH-DE.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6864] Zero result on shop while products are found
item.description:
When searching for typical switch descriptions (e.g. off) you get different results in the shop than in FF: http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/AdminMode.ff?sid=1D557A2283250C208D0397573186BEFA&uid=-675716761&cid=&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=bRe-ogF-h&productsPerPage=0&channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&query=%22%28ON%29-OFF-%28ON%29%22&x=89&y=21 vs. http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=%28on%29-off-%28on%29

As the results in FF are relevant and the ones on the shop have nothing to do with what the customers search, it is necessary to fix this asap.

The same goes for any random queries that are put in brackets (tested with (fish) & (schraube)) - so it would probably be wise to check what is transmitted to FF when setting these queries.
item.summary: Zero result on shop while products are found

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I just found the following line in the logfile analysis:

&#40ON&#41-OFF&#40ON&#41 8 0 0 0 0 0 #N/A

Might give a hint on what goes astray with these queries?

/Daniela

reproducable on Q:

http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=%28on%29-off-%28on%29

http://10.191.21.143:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?sid=9B98B6C4B1B81957BAF9041BAAE8B8AD&uid=1692933936&cid=&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=s1myZXduB&productsPerPage=50&channel=distrelec_Q_7310_ch_de&query=%28on%29-off-%28on%29&x=40&y=23
We replace those characters because of cross site scripting. I will change it accordingly.
Committed to branch v3.4. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6659] SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999
item.description:
Department Code "9999":
This will be the value for the Webshop to recognize that the contact person should is deactivated
http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/ERP+Codelist+-+DistDepartment

If we get the DistDepartment Code 9999 from SAP we should deactivate the contact.

If a deactivated contact person tries to login we should display the message" Your account is locked, please contact our customer care team" and in German "Ihr Zugang ist gesperrt, bitte wenden sie sich an unseren Kundendienst“
item.summary: SAP // Deactivate customer through department code 9999

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate, thx.

This approach is not the correct one. It does not make sense to deactivate a customer according to his/her department code. The soap response form SAP should contain a boolean flag saying the contact is active or not.

Is it possible that you implement some kind of Flag on SAP-side which is set when departement code 9999 is applied on the contact. We'll check this flag then from Webshop-side. What would be the impact?

Hello Rafael,
As we discussed this means a change on the read customer interface by adding one more field. The current solution needs to change and has been already implemented from our side. Please let me know how we will proceed
We will implement the "9999" dpt. code solution because of less efforts from SAP side. Otherwise the interface needs a CR.

Using the flag "active" only is not enough because even if the contact is not active he/she can still login in hybris. However, to disable the login, we need to set the flag "Login disabled" to true and the "Activated with Double Opt-In" to false. In this way we ensure that this contact will not be able to login in the future.

One main problem is if a contact has been deactivated in SAP but not yet in hybris, then we have the following scenarios:

  1. If the customer is B2C, then the contact will be able to login the first time but updated as deactivated in hybris. Next time he wont be able to login.
  2. If the customer is B2B:
  • If the deactivated contact isis the first one who logs in after the deactivation, here we have the same case as 1.
  • If another, active, contact already logged in just after the deactivation of the contact, then the contact is updated in hybris and he wont be able to login anymore.

That's fine for me - Can we implement a warning-message like this:
"Sorry, your account has been deactivated. Please contact customer service: Tel: [customer-service telnumber of respective country]
Email: [cusotmer-service email of respective country]"
?
Yes this is feasible. I already implemented this logic.
fixed.
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

Login: urs.bebie+test99@gmail.com
PW: Sensirion

I tested with the user above but it has not worked. I was able to login without error message although the contact person has the department 9999
After I have deleted this value on SAP site I was no longer able to login. I received the message "Your username or password was incorrect. If your login is not working anymore you can use the "registration with customer number" functionality in order to connect again with your active account..

Could you check it, please?
Nabil, please check last comment from Urs, thx.
fixed
It's working fine from my view. Let's test from business.

Hi Zisan
Please make some tests from business site.

Many thanks, Urs

Has been deployed to the test-systems (Q). Please test on the corresponding test-system for the ticket:

  • http://test.distrelec.ch/
  • http://test.distrelec.de/

Please test your assigned tickets & close(if it is ok) or reopen(if it is not ok).
If it is not ok, please assign directly back to the developer with a detailed comment describing what is wrong, thanks!
it works, but when I am logged in in language "german" i need to see a german sentence. Can you please translate and correct it?

The sentence should be:
"Es tut uns leid. Ihr Zugang wurde deaktiviert. Bitte kontaktieren Sie den Customer Service. Tel: 0421-3654200"

Or: " "Ihr Zugang ist gesperrt, bitte wenden sie sich an unseren Kundendienst“
Please add this to the property translations, thx.
Translation done.
Needs to be tested after v3.4.2 is on Q.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6541] Separate page title and breadcrumb | add breadcrumb field on page level
item.description:
Due to the fact that the pagetitle can't contain any special characters (e.g.: ä, ö, ü, é, è, à, č, š, ý, etc.) we require an additional field to maintain the breadcrumb content.
Like that we can put the correctly spelled words in the breadcrumb field and keep the ones where we replace all the special characters with normal characters in the page title.

Requirement:

  • In the CMS we need an additional field called "Breadcrumb" below the Page Title field for all page types
  • The field "Breadcrumb" has to be language specific (e.g. in CH: de, fr, en)
  • The content that currently is in the Page Title field has to be copied to the new field for every shop and language (e.g. in CH for http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Company/cms/unternehmen the page title and the breadcrumb field need to contain: Company, Unternehmen, Entreprise)

We will then be able to edit the content in the Breadcrumb field and add special characters too. The issue is most obvious in the Russian language shops where we right now have to put English Page Titles because the cyrillic alphabet is not supported (see attached screenshot)
item.summary: Separate page title and breadcrumb | add breadcrumb field on page level

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate and assign back to Rafael.

Hi guys
What's the status here? Did it not make it in the planned sprint I guess?
Thanks for an update!
BR, Marc

Ruben just let me know, that maybe the issue can be solved by just changing the way the Page Title field gets handled to avoid the redirect loop even with special characters.

On this page (http://www.distrelec.ch/de/Netzteile-%26-Licht/Batterien-Ladeger%C3%A4te-Regenerativ/Zubeh%C3%B6r-f%C3%BCr-Ger%C3%A4tebatterien-%26-Akkus/c/cat-L3D_525545) there are special characters in the breadcrumb, page title and URL and it works fine

I created a page on DE Q and added the same word once with, once without special characters to show the issue:
http://test.distrelec.de/de/cms/page_title_bug_test
http://test.distrelec.de/en/cms/page_title_bug_test

Could you please evaluate this solution?

Thx & BR, Marc
Please test after the next deployment

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6500] The shop returns wrong products at family level
item.description:
Hello,
The category /c/cat-26487 in the German Channels ( AT, DE, CH) returns wrong products. In the "Shop-family level" screenshot you can see the the shop category 26487; however when searching for a product shown in this category, FF shows that it actually belongs to a different category as you can see on the "FF-product" screenshot.

In English or other languages channels this issue does not happened, please check the following links from the German channel as an example:
EN:
http://www.distrelec.de/en/c/cat-26487
http://www.distrelec.de/en/c/cat-DC-82032
DE:
http://www.distrelec.de/de/c/cat-26487
http://www.distrelec.de/de/c/cat-DC-82032

It seems that the family names are the same in the shop, however the category IDs are different so it should not be an issue. Can you please investigate what happens and fix it asap.

Thanks,
Laura
item.summary: The shop returns wrong products at family level

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please estimate

Hi Will

We have another example where we have the same issue, in PIM the family names have the same name as you can see in the screenshot "PIM-Families"

The shop compiles all the families that have the same name, and this should not happen, (http://www.distrelec.ch/de/c/cat-DC-82509) please use the family ID.

Thanks,
Laura

Hi Laura

Please check our search request:

http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18031/FF_cat_search-request.jpg

A category search is based on the category code. What do you mean with the family ID?

Cheers
Will

Hi Laura

FF is returning different results for the same category but in different channels (DE-DE, DE-EN). The FF search request is exactly the same, only the channel is different. Can we check this together in the FF backend? We need to figure out if we export those categories in a wrong way or if its a FF problem only.

DE-DE:
http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/Kabelverbinder/c/cat-26487

http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?query=*&filterCategory3=Kabelschuhe+%2F+Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse&filterCategory5=Kabelverbinder&filterCategory4=Kabelverbinder+farbig&channel=distrelec_P_7350_de_de&site=demoshop&sid=9F3BFDC9FD0EB356DF3227EACC9F84DC&uid=1692933936&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=atqXILlRk

DE-EN:
http://www.distrelec.de/en/Components/Cables-%26-Installation-Materials/Cable-Lugs-Crimp-Terminals/Splice-Connectors%2C-Coloured/Butt-Connectors/c/cat-26487

http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?query=butt+connectors&filterCategory3=Cable+Lugs+%2F+Crimp+Terminals&filterCategory5=Butt+Connectors&filterCategory4=Splice+Connectors%2C+Coloured&channel=distrelec_P_7350_de_en&followSearch=9947&site=demoshop&sid=9F3BFDC9FD0EB356DF3227EACC9F84DC&uid=1692933936&site=demoshop&sourceRefKey=G8QxR_7ID

Thx
Will

Hi Will,

The problem is in DE language, we have categories that have the same name in PIM but do have different category IDs (you can see that in the screenshot PIM-families.png).

In FF backend you can see that the products have the right category ID from PIM.

It seems that the shop is grouping the products according to the category name and not to the ID.

Does this make the issue more clear to you?

Thanks,
Laura
Wrote my analysis in an email to Mr Türk. Wait for his answer.

Hallo Herr Spalinger,

die Anzeige eines Produktes auf Produktübersichtsseiten, hängt von mehreren Faktoren ab:

  • erfolgreicher Import der CSV-Datei
  • kein Ausschluss über Ranking-Regeln
  • kein Ausschluss über das ExcludeProductsSearchCallback-Kriterium
  • eine ausreichend hohe Bandbreite (Konfiguration > Relevanz), um sämtliche der Kategorie zugehörige Produkte auszuliefern

Ist sichergestellt, dass diese Faktoren in den Channels übereinstimmen?

Für eine kurze Rückmeldung wäre ich Ihnen dankbar.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

I checke now the categoryPath of two products: 14824272 & 14821460. In DE DE both are shown. In DE EN only one is shown: 14824272

DE-DE:
http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/Kabelverbinder/c/cat-26487

DE-EN:
http://www.distrelec.de/en/Components/Cables-%26-Installation-Materials/Cable-Lugs-Crimp-Terminals/Splice-Connectors%2C-Coloured/Butt-Connectors/c/cat-26487

14824272: CategoryPathROOT=Components|CategoryPathROOT/Components=Cables & Installation Materials|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials=Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals=Splice Connectors, Coloured|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured=Butt Connectors| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured/Butt Connectors=Butt Connector|
14821460: CategoryPathROOT=Components|CategoryPathROOT/Components=Cables & Installation Materials|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials=Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals=Splice Connectors, Coloured|CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured=Splice Connector| CategoryPathROOT/Components/Cables & Installation Materials/Cable Lugs %2F Crimp Terminals/Splice Connectors, Coloured/Splice Connector=ELECTRO-TAP|

Then I checked the category structure of the products in hmc. The category structure is completly different, thats why we they have a different category path.

Also check this two category urls (same results size):

http://www.distrelec.de/en/Components/Cables-%26-Installation-Materials/Cable-Lugs-Crimp-Terminals/Splice-Connectors%2C-Coloured/c/cat-21115
-> containing 3 child categories

http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/c/cat-21115
-> containing no child categories

I will have a look at this issue together with Daniela.

Cheers
Will

Hallo Herr Türk

Herr Spalinger und ich sitzen gerade zusammen und schauen uns das Ganze an. Wir machen schon eine Filterung via ID, allerdings scheint diese bei gleichen Kategorienamen nicht zu greifen. Als Beispiel:

http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/Kabelverbinder/c/cat-26487
26487 ist eine Familie in PIM, die 3 Produkte enthält.

Die Überkategorie (http://www.distrelec.de/de/Komponenten/Kabel-%26-Installationsmaterial/Kabelschuhe-Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse/Kabelverbinder-farbig/c/cat-21115) enthält vier aktive Sub-Kategorien (Familien) mit demselben Namen.

Wie Sie sehen, führen beide Links auf praktisch dieselbe Produktauswahl, obwohl wir im ersten Fall ein Level tiefer sind und nur drei Produkte sehen sollten.

Können Sie sich das bitte anschauen und uns sagen, woran dass das liegt? Herr Spalinger schaut sich ebenfalls auch noch mal an, ob von unserer Seite her nicht noch Parameter mitgegeben werden, die das Resultat verfälschen.

Vielen Dank für Ihr Feedback & freundliche Grüsse
Daniela Truttmann

Customer Experience Manager

Hallo Frau Truttmann,
ich gehe davon aus, dass die generierte FACT-Finder Anfrage nicht stimmt. Das Ergebnis unterscheidet sich, wie die Verwendung von vier oder fünf Kategorie-Ebenen über das FACT-Finder Backend veranschaulicht:
5 Ebenen:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&navigation=true&filterCategory1=Komponenten&filterCategory2=Kabel+%26+Installationsmaterial&filterCategory3=Kabelschuhe+%2F+Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse&filterCategory4=Kabelverbinder+farbig&filterCategory5=Kabelverbinder

4 Ebenen:
http://10.191.20.145:8080/FACT-Finder-hybris/Search.ff?channel=distrelec_P_7310_ch_de&navigation=true&filterCategory1=Komponenten&filterCategory2=Kabel+%26+Installationsmaterial&filterCategory3=Kabelschuhe+%2F+Crimpanschl%C3%BCsse&filterCategory4=Kabelverbinder+farbig
Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
Will be discussed with Daniela on 21.05.2015

Hallo Herr Türk

Wir haben das nun intern angeschaut. Da wir im Request ja bereits den Kategorie code mitschicken, könnten Sie einen Lookup nach productFamilyCode machen und falls dieser keine Resultate liefert den normalen Lookup wie bis anhin per Kategoriename in den Filtern?

Wir müssten wissen ob das so möglich ist und wieviel uns das kosten würde.

Besten Dank für Ihr Feedback und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
ist mit "Lookup", der Einfluss auf die gefilterte Produktliste oder die Facetten-Anzeige/Sortierung gemeint?
Wird im FACT-Finder Request auch der genannte Code übermittelt?
Schon jetzt danke für eine kurze Rückmeldung.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
*************************
Hallo Herr Türk

Ja genau das ist damit gemeint. Der genannte Code wird bereits im FF request übermittelt.

Besten Dank für Ihr Feedback und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
danke für die Info. In den Suchlogs konnte ich kein Vorkommnis dazu finden.
Wird der Code als Parameter oder als Filter übertragen? Könnten Sie mir bitte den Soap-Request als XML-Datei zukommen lassen?
Vielen Dank im Voraus.
Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development

Hallo Herr Türk

Ich habe gerade den SOAP request überprüft und festgestellt das wir den Kategoriecode noch nicht mitschicken. Ich habe das nun angepasst, dann würden wir bei einer Kategoriesuche die Filter wie gehabt und neu noch den „query“ parameter mit dem Kategoriecode senden.

Würde das für Sie so funktionieren?

Im Anhang finden Sie den angepassten search request. --> http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18335/soap_request_category-search.txt

Besten Dank und schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
danke für die Infos.
Das würde mit dem query-Parameter nicht funktionieren, da der Einsatz des "navigation=true" Parameters den übermittelten Suchbegriff überschreibt.
Ich schlage vor, dass der Code als weiterer Filter übermittelt wird, sofern er einen Unterschied bewirkt. Hierbei reicht es aus, den Code als Filter im Request zu übermitteln. Eine dazugehörige Filter-Gruppe braucht für diesen Zweck nicht unter Konfiguration > ASN / Navigation eingerichtet zu werden.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
**********************
Hallo Herr Türk

Besten Dank für die Info. Dann werde ich den code als weiteren Filter übermitteln. Wie soll der Filter heissen? Ns2:name?

                       <ns2:Filter>
                            <ns2:name>Category5</ns2:name>
                            <ns2:valueList>
                                <ns2:FilterValue>
                                    <ns2:type>or</ns2:type>
                                    <ns2:value>Kabelverbinder</ns2:value>
                                </ns2:FilterValue>
                            </ns2:valueList>
                        </ns2:Filter>

Schöne Grüsse
W. Spalinger

Hallo Herr Spalinger,
der Filtername entspricht hier dem Namen des Feldes aus dem CSV-Export, d.h: productFamilyCode.

Beste Grüße
Gebriyel Türk
FACT-Finder Project Development
Committed in v3.4 branch. Ready for Q deployment.

Has been deployed to the test-systems (Q). Please test on the corresponding test-system for the ticket:

  • http://test.distrelec.ch/
  • http://test.distrelec.de/

Please test your assigned tickets & close(if it is ok) or reopen(if it is not ok).
If it is not ok, please assign directly back to the developer with a detailed comment describing what is wrong, thanks!

Hi Will,

I can see the families correctly when I click on the breadcrumb or in the family link for each products.

In the categories listed above the product list, I noticed the following in DE_DE channel: in the screenshot http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18402/screenshot-1.png it is displayed that we have 15 products, but when you click on it, only 3 products are shown(http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18403/screenshot-2.png).The issue is still not completely fixed.

Please check it again,

Thanks,
Laura
check http://test.distrelec.de/de/komponenten/kabel-installationsmaterial/kabelschuhe-crimpanschluesse/kabelverbinder-farbig/c/cat-21115 and fix it as discussed.
Now the product family code filter is only active for the family link. All other category requests stay the same as before. I committed to v3.4 branch. Ready for Q deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6254] EOL // Wrong replacement product
item.description:
If an item has a sales status 60 (END OF LIFE) and we get a replacement product from the ERP (IF-01) then we are showing a warning message on top of the product page.

For example:
"The product Resistor SMD 15 Ohm 1210 PU=5000p., article number 725174 is end of life. You may order the successor product below."

If I call the EOL product directly through the URL (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Resistor-SMD-47-Ohm-1210-PU%3D5000-ST-Panasonic-Automotive-%26-Industrial-Systems-ERJP14F47R0U/p/11083319?replacementFor=11025585)
The we see the correct replacement page below the warning message

If I call the EOL product through the search then I get the same replacement product as the EOL product. (e.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=725180)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hi Neeraj,

Could you please provide me with a Status update there. Thanks in advance
"as discussed, Will gonna check the "replacement process" with Rafael .

Hi Neeraj

In my opinion with this url http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=725180 the replacement product is not loaded correctly. we display still the old product. In the searchpagecontroller we need to check if the requested product has a replacement and if so we need to redirect to the replacement product and load also the replacement product and not the requested product.

Cheers
Will
Ready for testing
Has been deployed to Q - Please test, thanks.

Hi Oana,

thanks for your efforts. Unfortunately, the problem is not solved the way we expected it to work:

1. The note about a replacement article is no longer present. But it really should be because the customer has to get a transparent hint that his searched article is replaced. Please reactivate the note like this:

2. There are two kinds of possible Replacement codes coming from SAP: x_A for automatic replacement and x_M for manual replacement. If the code means manual, there should be no automatic replacement. Instead of this, I would recommend a gray note like “The product #NAME#. article number is obsolete. You may order the succeeding product here (link to replacement product). Then the originating product should follow, not the successor. Is this possible to be realized in Hybris? I guess it could be done almost easily if the right information comes from SAP.

3. Articles with a SAP Status below 50 should be checked for stock. If there is still stock, the articled should not be replaced automatically. Even if they are set to automatically replacement. Instead of this, solution 2 would be the best. Is it possible to solve this in Hybris? Has Hybris the stock information when rendering the page? If not, the simplest way to solve this is to handle all replacements optionally like case 2. But that should be discussed with our user experience specialists (whoever they are).

A quick idea from my side: Maybe we should think of using only the workaround from point 3: Always show only a hint, that a replacement exists, but no automatically redirection. No analysis of replacement code or stock values. Total control and transparency to the customer, and less work for the IT. Who dares to decide this? Maybe Kevin will favor this kind of quick, simple solution and we can return to all the other projects.

Best regards
Cord

Hi Rafael,

I am summarizing here the call which we have regarding this task. Information from Hybris point of view
1. we don't have stock information and ERP sales status when we render product details page, how ever it is possible to find out these information but doing that might be take longer time to render this page as we have to do this each time when a product details page is called.
2. There are so many other replacment reasons as well coming from sap which is not clear what to do in that case. If needed a complete list of all these can be provided.

If we through the summary from the note above

A quick idea from my side: Maybe we should think of using only the workaround from point 3: Always show only a hint, that a replacement exists, but no automatically redirection.
That means :-
No analysis of replacement code or stock values. Total control and transparency to the customer, and less work for the IT.
Who dares to decide this? Maybe Kevin will favor this kind of quick, simple solution and we can return to all the other projects.

If that is the solution how it should be then I guess our current implementation is exactly the same. Please validate the same with product mentioned on the jira task. i.g. http://www.distrelec.ch/en/Resistor-SMD-47-Ohm-1210-PU%3D5000-ST-Panasonic-Automotive-%26-Industrial-Systems-ERJP14F47R0U/p/11083319?replacementFor=11025585)

Hi Oana,
Please advise how to continue, thx.

Call with Cord on 03.06.2015

One solution should be implemented on both cases: MANUAL & AUTOMATIC:

On the originating product page, the following message should appear:
“The product #NAME#. article number is obsolete. You may order the succeeding product here (link to replacement product).“

Then the originating product should follow on the page, not the successor.
The changes has been done and it is ready for testing. Please test it after next deployment in Q.
